item.title: Gas price rise: Government considering loans for energy firms
item.description: The business secretary is holding crisis talks as firms battle to stay afloat amid a surge in gas prices.

item.title: Aukus: France pulls out of UK defence talks amid row
item.description: Paris is angry after Australia cancelled a submarine contract in favour of a deal with the UK and US.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The Crown and Ted Lasso sweep major categories
item.description: Netflix's royal drama and Apple's comedy series swept the drama and comedy prizes at Sunday's event.

item.title: Gabby Petito: Body matching missing woman found in Wyoming
item.description: Crews searching for the missing Florida woman have found a body in a national park, the FBI says.

item.title: Football agent Aidy Ward broke rules by targeting minors
item.description: Aidy Ward also tried to involve his then-client Raheem Sterling in a bid to attract an under-age player.

item.title: Killamarsh deaths: Man arrested after four bodies found
item.description: A murder investigation is under way after the bodies were discovered in Killamarsh, Derbyshire.

item.title: Canary Islands: Spanish PM arrives amid volcano eruption
item.description: Pedro Sanchez has arrived on La Palma where a volcanic eruption has forced evacuations.

item.title: Climate pledges tough to secure before COP26 summit, PM warns
item.description: Boris Johnson says he has a "six out of 10" chance of securing pledges before the COP26 conference.

item.title: Folic acid to be added to UK flour to help prevent birth defects
item.description: It is estimated that fortifying flour with folic acid could prevent up to 200 birth defects a year.

item.title: MP Rosie Duffield says public women always thinking about security
item.description: Rosie Duffield says she will not be attending Labour's conference because of fears about her safety.

item.title: Russia election: Putin's party heads for victory amid vote fraud claims
item.description: The pro-Kremlin United Russia party is on course for a majority in a parliamentary vote.

item.title: Northern Line extension: Two new Tube stations open
item.description: The Northern Line extension serves new stations at Nine Elms and Battersea Power Station.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The Crown and Ted Lasso win big
item.description: Netflix drama The Crown and Apple TV Plus comedy Ted Lasso were the stars of the Emmy Award.

item.title: My husband and son fought in Afghanistan - it changed all of us
item.description: America's two decades in Afghanistan impacted those who served - and the families waiting at home.

item.title: The papers: Energy firms seek support and 'goodbye Greavsie'
item.description: The fallout from the ongoing gas crisis and the death of footballer Jimmy Greaves feature on the front pages.

item.title: My dad, held hostage in Iran
item.description: London-based baker Elika Ashoori is campaigning to bring her father home from jail in Iran.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: ICYMI: Surfing dogs and Spain's 'ugliest tomato' contest
item.description: Dogs are making a splash in our round-up of the stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

item.title: Volcano on Canary Island La Palma erupts, spewing ash and lava into national park
item.description: Video shows the volcano, on La Palma, spewing ash and lava in its first major eruption since 1971.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.

item.title: Giving birth under the Taliban
item.description: Pregnant women, new mothers and infants are bearing the brunt of a worsening healthcare crisis.

item.title: Can apps manage our chronic health conditions?
item.description: A Swedish tech firm has created an app to help alleviate people's joint pain.

item.title: John Challis and Boycie - how one of TV's greatest comedy characters was born
item.description: The late actor was known for playing Only Fools and Horses' smarmy second-hand car salesman Boycie.

item.title: Canada election: What you need to know about the campaign
item.description: Canadians are voting on Monday and Justin Trudeau's party faces a stiff challenge to retain power.

item.title: Submarine pact delivers France some hard truths
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield assesses the harsh realities for France after Australia's US-UK deal.

item.title: Nadine Dorries: Best-selling author, nurse, reality star and, now, cabinet minister
item.description: Mistrusted by some in the arts, the new culture secretary is said by a colleague to be "up for the fight".

item.title: Turkmenistan: Getting Covid in a land where no cases officially exist
item.description: People in Turkmenistan are struggling to get treatment in a system that denies there are any cases.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Chelsea beat Spurs to extend unbeaten run & go joint top
item.description: Chelsea stretch their unbeaten Premier League run to five games as Thomas Tuchel's team deservedly beat Tottenham.

item.title: Football pays tribute to Greaves, one of the game's great finishers
item.description: Tottenham and Chelsea lead the tributes for their former player Jimmy Greaves, who has died aged 81.

item.title: 'Everything was a bit crazy' - how Noble came off bench for a penalty & it did not go to plan
item.description: Substitute Mark Noble sees his injury-time penalty saved by David de Gea, who last kept out a spot-kick in 2014.

item.title: The 'real deal'? 'Too good for second fiddle'? Find out who made Garth Crooks' team of week
item.description: Who is proving to be the 'real deal'? Who is too good to be playing second fiddle? Who has been 'a giant'? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

item.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: How Manchester United beat West Ham in Premier League
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Mark Chapman, Alan Shearer and Dion Dublin discuss Jesse Lingard's "cracker" and Mark Noble's injury-time penalty miss in Manchester United's 2-1 victory over West Ham in the Premier League.

item.title: What are the travel rules now and for half term?
item.description: The rules on foreign travel to and from England are being simplified.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid: People are vaccinated - so why are there so many cases?
item.description: More than four out of five UK adults are now fully vaccinated, but daily case rates remain high.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: Significant numbers have had long-term problems after recovering from the original infection.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What's in England's 'Winter Plan'?
item.description: Lockdown rules have changed across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: Will I need a jab and what will university be like this term?
item.description: Many Covid restrictions have been lifted for students going to university this term.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid passports: How do I get one and when will I need it?
item.description: People in Scotland will need to be fully vaccinated to go to clubs, sporting events and concerts.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Face coverings could become a legal requirement in England again if the NHS struggles this winter.

item.title: Flu jab 2021: Who’s eligible for a free vaccine?
item.description: This year's roll out has expanded in an attempt to shield against a double whammy of flu and Covid.

item.title: Is it safe to vaccinate our child? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about vaccinating 12-15 year-olds, the booster vaccine and other topics.

item.title: Muriel Gardiner: The heiress who saved countless lives
item.description: Muriel Gardiner's courage fighting fascism in Austria inspired an Oscar-winning film. Who was she?

item.title: Hushpuppi - the Instagram influencer and international fraudster
item.description: How Nigerian Ramon Abbas went from a romance scammer to a so-called "Billionaire Gucci Master".

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: 'The near-death experience that made me a top musician'
item.description: When Tony Kofi had a near-fatal accident, he had a vision of himself playing a musical instrument. It would change his life forever.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.
